page.title: 12LIFE IN THE PAST 1900-1985
page.content: In order to get a picture of the changes which have taken place in the area we interviewed a Mrs Oulton aged 85.She was born on the edge of the area just outside the village of Ryton She came from a large family with 5 brothers and a sister.She started school at the age of 4 and attended the same village school in Ryton until she was 14.She then went to Wellington College. As a child she had a donkey which she had to look after.She also had to help on the farm as there was only one man to help and no machinery.They kept a pig which was slaughtered and its manure was used as fertilizer.At that time many people were employed on the estate as farming was done by hand using horses.All the workers lived on the estate and formed a community of their own.Few people live there now.
